docs.lead_paragraph: Diabetes that develops early in pregnancy may increase women's chances of having a child with autism, according to a new study.

headline.print_headline: Autism Could Be Linked With Moms' Diabetes During Pregnancy

docs.lead_paragraph: Lawyers for an American couple on trial in Indonesia argued Tuesday that prosecutors improperly charged them with premeditated murder in the death of the woman's mother.

docs.lead_paragraph: A Florida woman who fled with her son to keep his circumcision from going forward has filed a civil rights lawsuit on behalf of the boy, hoping a federal judge might intervene where state judges haven't.

docs.lead_paragraph: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said 2014 was marked by harrowing accounts of rape, sexual slavery and forced marriage being used by extremists including the Islamic State group and Boko Haram.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Kitzinger was a British anthropologist who encouraged women around the world to reclaim from doctors their natural prerogative over pregnancy and childbirth.

headline.main: Sheila Kitzinger, Childbirth Revolutionary, Dies at 86
headline.print_headline: Sheila Kitzinger, Childbirth Revolutionary, Dies at 86

docs.abstract: Sheila Kitzinger, British anthropologist and icon of home birth, dies at age 86.
docs.snippet: Mrs. Kitzinger was a British anthropologist who encouraged women around the world to reclaim from doctors their natural prerogative over pregnancy and childbirth.

docs.lead_paragraph: A 65-year-old German mother of 13 is getting ready to give birth again — this time to quadruplets.

headline.main: German Mother of 13 Pregnant With Quadruplets at Age 65
headline.print_headline: German Mother of 13 Pregnant With Quadruplets at Age 65

headline.print_headline: The No. 1 Killer of Women, Too

docs.abstract: They represent “the leading edge of a brewing storm” of rising cardiovascular risk factors with potentially fatal consequences.
docs.snippet: They represent “the leading edge of a brewing storm” of rising cardiovascular risk factors with potentially fatal consequences.

docs.lead_paragraph: Special victim status for fetuses sets a dangerous precedent.

headline.main: How Not to Protect Pregnant Women
headline.print_headline: How Not to Protect Pregnant Women

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Deborah Tuerkheimer opposes Colorado bill that would criminalize fetal homicide, observing that nearly 40 states already have such laws; argues laws are not meant to protect pregnant women, but rather to further cause of limiting abortion rights; warns granting personhood to fetuses makes women criminal responsible for their well-being, leading to host of potential legal abuses.
docs.snippet: Special victim status for fetuses sets a dangerous precedent.

docs.lead_paragraph: Catherine Hiller, the author of “Just Say Yes: A Marijuana Memoir,” says daily use did not lead her to harder drugs.

headline.main: Smoking Marijuana for 50 Years, and Turning Out Just Fine
headline.print_headline: Smoking Marijuana for 50 Years, and Turning Out Just Fine

docs.abstract: Side Street; profile of author Catherine Hiller, whose book Just Say Yes: A Marijuana Memoir describes her experience smoking marijuana on a near-daily basis for the past 50 years; Hiller says she wrote book to counter myths that regular marijuana use has dire consequences.
docs.snippet: Catherine Hiller, the author of “Just Say Yes: A Marijuana Memoir,” says daily use did not lead her to harder drugs.
